title: Balken typeface
content: I tried to find the typeface berthold balken, but can't find it anywhere. Where can I find it?
author: Roland Brauchli

comments.content: You'd have to ask [Berthold Types](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012021046/http:/bertholdtypes.com/), since they get [downright testy](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012021046/http:/typophile.com/node/5063) about anyone messing with their typefaces or font names. I'm guessing it's not been digitized or is no longer available.
Ken, there's a lot of history that I won't go into, but try not to dig up the dirt here. I just hope no one asks for the thread to be deleted now.

If I remember correctly, it was once available. Is that the one that looks like a mutant [Venus](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012021046/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=venus) with a very high waist?
yes, stephen that is the one. It is listed in an old linotype library, but not on the berthold site.

I know it was once available as a Berthold digital font, because it's in the third edition of [FontBook](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012021046/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontBook), but I suppose there were some trademark disputes because it's no longer available as far as I can see. I'd write Berthold and ask. Let us know what they have to say!
